ojc.bain.base

Class NeuronCollection<C extends ComponentConfiguration>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
      • ojc.bain.base.ComponentCollection
        • ojc.bain.base.ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>
          • ojc.bain.base.NeuronCollection<C>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, ComponentConfigurationListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FixedFrequencyNeuronCollection, FixedProtocolNeuronCollection, LinearNeuronCollection, NeuronRandom

    public abstract class NeuronCollection<C extends ComponentConfiguration>
extends ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>

    Base class for all collections neurons. Sub-classes should update the values of the neuronOutputs array when the step() method is invoked. See ComponentCollection for details on implementing the step() and run() methods.

    Sub-classes must override the methods run(), ComponentCollection.createCollection(int size) ConfigurableComponentCollection.getConfigSingleton(). Sub-classes will need to override the methods init(),reset() and ComponentCollection.ensureStateVariablesAreFresh() if they use custom state variables. Sub-classes may wish/need to override the methods: step(), ComponentCollection.getStateVariableNames() and ComponentCollection.getStateVariableValues(int).

    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman

      • neuronInputs

        protected double[] neuronInputs
        The current input values of the neurons. Input comprises external input and input via synapses.

      • inputsModified

        protected boolean inputsModified
        Flag to indicate if any of the inputs to the neurons have been modified. This is used to determine if we need to put() the neuronInputs array/buffer when using OpenCL.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Initialise the collection. This method should be called from a sub-classes constructor. Sub-classes should override this method to generate pre-calculated values used during the simulation, and call this super-method. Arrays/buffers initialised here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        init in class ConfigurableComponentCollection<C extends ComponentConfiguration>

      • spiked

        public boolean spiked(int index)
        Returns true iff the specified spiked in the last time step.

        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Returns the output of the specified component for the last time step.
        Specified by:
        getOutput in class ComponentCollection

      • getOutputs

        public double[] getOutputs()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Returns the underlying array of output values. This method is provided for efficiency reasons, the values of the array should not be altered. The values in the array returned by this method may become stale if the step() method is invoked subsequently; to get fresh values this method should be invoked again (this will return the same array but will also ensure that the values in the array are up to date by invoking ensureOutputsAreFresh()).
        Specified by:
        getOutputs in class ComponentCollection

      • getSpikings

        public boolean[] getSpikings()
        Returns the underlying array of spikings. This method is provided for efficiency reasons, the values of the array should not be altered. The values in the array returned by this method may become stale if the step() method is invoked subsequently; to get fresh values this method should be invoked again (this will return the same array but will also ensure that the values in the array are up to date by invoking ensureOutputsAreFresh()).

      • getInputs

        public double[] getInputs()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Returns the underlying array of input values. This method is provided for efficiency reasons, the values of the array should not be altered directly. The values in the array returned by this method may become stale if the step() method is invoked subsequently; to get fresh values this method should be invoked again (this will return the same array but will also ensure that the values in the array are up to date by invoking ensureInputsAreFresh()).
        Specified by:
        getInputs in class ComponentCollection

      • addInput

        public void addInput(int index,
            double input)
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Add input to the specified component. The given input is added onto the existing input value.
        Specified by:
        addInput in class ComponentCollection

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the components to their initial state. Sub-classes should override this method if they have state variables that may be reset to an initial state. Arrays/buffers reset here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put(). The implementation of this method in NeuronCollection resets the values for neuronOutputs, neuronSpikings and neuronInputs to 0. If any of these values should be set to something other than 0, then this method should be overridden, and this super-method called from the overriding method before setting the values to the correct value and calling put([modified array]) with the relevant array.
        Overrides:
        reset in class ComponentCollection

      • step

        public void step()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Update the model over one time step. Sub-classes should call this super method. The step() method will invoke the overridden run() method which defines the Aparapi kernel. This method sets ComponentCollection.stateVariablesStale and ComponentCollection.outputsStale to true.
        Overrides:
        step in class ComponentCollection

      • run

        public void run()
        Implements the basic infrastructure for processing a neuron by resetting the value of neuronInputs and setting the value for neuronSpikings. Sub-classes must override this method and call the super-method after they have made use of the value in neuronInputs. Alternatively, if neuronInputs should be reset to something other than 0 or a neuron spike is represented by something other than a value of 1 in neuronOutputs, then this super-method need not be called and the overriding method should instead reset the values for neuronInputs and set the value for neuronSpikings.
        Specified by:
        run in class com.amd.aparapi.Kernel

      • ensureOutputsAreFresh

        public void ensureOutputsAreFresh()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Ensures the outputs, as provided by ComponentCollection.getOutput(int index) and ComponentCollection.getOutputs() have been fetched from the remote execution hardware (eg GPU) if necessary. See ComponentCollection.outputsAreStale().
        Specified by:
        ensureOutputsAreFresh in class ComponentCollection

      • ensureInputsAreFresh

        public void ensureInputsAreFresh()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Ensures the inputs, as provided by ComponentCollection.getInput(int index) and ComponentCollection.getInputs() have been fetched from the remote execution hardware (eg GPU) if necessary. See ComponentCollection.inputsAreStale().
        Specified by:
        ensureInputsAreFresh in class ComponentCollection
